intro: Aeonium spathulatum, commonly known as the spoon-leaf aeonium, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are spoon-shaped, giving it its common name. The plant produces vibrant clusters of yellow flowers during the summer months. It is highly drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil. Aeonium spathulatum is popular in rock gardens and as a houseplant due to its ornamental appearance and ease of care.
